Package jdraw.framework

Interface DrawContext

  • public interface DrawContext
    The interface DrawContext represents the context which contains and presents the draw view. It contains methods to access the contained view and a convenience method to access the associated model. DrawContext provides methods to communicate with the context, e.g. in order to display status messages and to add Menu Actions and tool factories.
    Version:
    2.5
    Author:
    Dominik Gruntz & Christoph Denzler
    See Also:
    DrawView, DrawModel

    • Method Detail

      • getView

        DrawView getView()
        Returns the context's drawing view.
        Returns:
        the draw view controlled by this context

      • getModel

        DrawModel getModel()
        Returns the draw model presented by this context's view. Returns the same result as getView().getModel().
        Returns:
        the draw model presented by this context's view.

      • showStatusText

        void showStatusText​(java.lang.String msg)
        Shows a status message in the context's user interface.
        Parameters:
        msg - the status message to be displayed

      • addMenu

        void addMenu​(javax.swing.JMenu menu)
        Adds a menu in the editor's user interface.
        Parameters:
        menu - the menu to be added

      • removeMenu

        void removeMenu​(javax.swing.JMenu menu)
        Removes a menu in the editor's user interface.
        Parameters:
        menu - the menu to be removed

      • addTool

        void addTool​(DrawTool tool)
        Adds a draw tool to the editor's capabilities. An editor has a list of tools that are available to the user. This list must guarantee that any tool is contained only once in the list.
        Parameters:
        tool - a new draw tool to add to the editor.

      • getTool

        DrawTool getTool()
        Returns the currently active tool.
        Returns:
        active tool

      • setTool

        void setTool​(DrawTool tool)
        Sets the tool to be used.
        Parameters:
        tool - tool to be used by the draw view

      • setDefaultTool

        void setDefaultTool()
        Sets the default tool (selection and moving of figures).

      • showView

        void showView()
        Make the view visible.
